meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a town.
meanings.sent1: The small houses and bustling streets gave the neighborhood a townish feel.
meanings.sent2: The townish atmosphere of the market made me feel right at home.
meanings.sent3: The townish decorations at the party made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her townish manners were a breath of fresh air in the city.
meanings.sent5: The townish charm of the cafe drew in customers from far and wide.

meanings.definition: Having the qualities or characteristics of a town.
meanings.sent1: The townish architecture of the building fit in perfectly with the surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The townish layout of the park made it easy to navigate.
meanings.sent3: His townish outfit was a hit at the costume party.
meanings.sent4: The townish vibe of the event brought the community together.
meanings.sent5: The townish sounds of the bells ringing echoed through the streets.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to or typical of a town.
meanings.sent1: The townish traditions were passed down through generations.
meanings.sent2: The townish events were always a highlight of the year.
meanings.sent3: The townish gossip spread quickly through the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: Her townish accent reminded him of home.
meanings.sent5: The townish landmarks were a source of pride for the residents.
